name: Doubletree Suites by Hilton Hotel Anaheim Resort - Convention Center

reviews.text: I spent 3 nights here for a convention, and had a great experience. I had a suite on the 6th floor which was very roomy, and had 2 flat-screens, fridge and microwave. Housekeeping did a fabulous job and the front desk staff members were friendly and helpful. I was worried when I checked in since my room was directly across from the vending/ice machine area, but I never heard a thing. The rooms are SO quiet, and I know the hotel was fully booked during my stay. Very convenient for the convention center and there are shuttles to Disneyland. If you are traveling with kids ask for a room that faces the Disney fireworks, but you also get a great view from the pool deck. I got room service one night and the food was very good.
reviews.title: Quiet with spacious rooms and excellent service

reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel for both business travelers and families. The suites are spatious and full of amenities, such as a microwave, fridge, and free wireless. The beds were comfortable and our housekeeping service was excellent. Front desk staff were friendly and answered all of our questions. The breakfast buffet (pricey if you don't have a voucher ~ $14) had a large variety of delicious items that rotated daily. There is a coffee shop with Starbucks coffee and bakery items. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the convention center and it right on the ART bus route, so it's easy to hop on at the end of the driveway and get to almost anywhere in Anaheim you'd like to go (Disneyland! GardenWalk!). Every time I looked out at the pool it was empty; not overrun with children like other hotels I visited for the conference. Definitely felt this hotel was a good choice for a business traveler who likes to "get away" from all the convention & Disney craziness!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for convention!

reviews.text: The Doubletree Suites was the perfect choice for visiting Anaheim. Our family of four visited last week and had a suite which included one room with Two double beds with Flat Screen Television and then another decent size room with a couch, chairs, desk, Flat screen television, microwave and small refrigerator. While there was only one bathroom, the sink and counter outsdie the bathroom was a very nice size and allowed for multiple female teenagers to get ready for the day. This layout was perfect as it allowed for children to have some space away from the adults. Additionally the hotel is fairly new and extremely clean. Housekeeping was exceptional. All employees encountered were very friendly and willing to help with directions or requests. Additionally, the hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland (Approx 1 mile) and the Garden Walk (Many good restaurants) and only about 2.5 miles from Angel Stadium. The hotel charges $16 a day to park at the hotel, but the lot has ample spaces and is very convenient to get in and out of. An additional perk is free wi-fi at the hotel. As there are so many great restaurants around the hotel, we did not eat at the hotel so cannot comment on that. I would highly recommend the Doubletree. Next time in Anaheim will definitely make this our first choice.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice for Anaheim

reviews.text: Large suites. With the kids getting older the space was much needed. We ordered a room with two beds in the bedroom and the fold out in the sitting area. Front staff were GREAT. We were there for our daughter's graduation. Front desk, concierge, and Starbucks person always congratulated her when we walked in and out with her MICKEY MOUSE graduation cap on.
reviews.title: Large and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Close to Disneyland. Some people were walking, but a bit far after walking the park all day. Parking is not included. It is a bit high. We were aware of that before we got there.
reviews.title: Okay, and close to Disneyland

reviews.text: No regrets in selecting this hotel for our 3 nights stay in Anaheim. Before our trip, I had requested where possible if I can check-in early as I was on a very early morning flight. The prompt email reply advised that they would try their very best as it was the peak holiday season in the US. Upon arrival, the front desk reception was already aware of my request, and suggested that I get breakfast & come back an hour & half later while they try to get a room ready for us. True to their words, a room was prepared for our check-in, and the best part was we got an upgrade to a suite!
reviews.title: Top notch service & excellent location

reviews.text: The suite was spacious, clean & fairly quiet (noise came from a couple of kids running down the hall in the middle of the night). A courtesy note was advised that due to upgrading being done in the hotel, guests were reminded of construction noises during the daytime.
reviews.title: Comfortable accomodations

reviews.text: Outside the hotel, you can hop on the ART buses that take you directly to Disneyland and around Anaheim area - so very convenient. Otherwise a casual stroll of 20 minutes from the hotel would take you in no time to the Disneyland as well.
reviews.title: Clean and fun
Beware of additional charges!
reviews.text: If you want great & attentive service, this hotel comes highly recommended.

The suite was roomy, clean and quiet. Our time in the room was relaxing after the long walks to and around the parks. The area was centrally located to food and entertainment, within walking distance to the parks and other activities. A car was broken into during our stay in the parking lot, so just a reminder to not leave anything in the car.
reviews.title: Let Down - below Hilton Standards

reviews.text: Stayed in the Doubletree suites in February. Loved the room, location and amenities. Breakfast was great. Location was convenient.
reviews.title: Great location, terrific stay

reviews.text: We just got back from a 4 night stay at the Anaheim Doubletree Suites. We typically stay either at one of the Disneyland Resort Hotels or at one of the cheaper motels/hotels across the street from the front gates of Disneyland. The motels across the street are often noisy and the beds can be uncomfortable. This hotel is a bit further up Harbor Blvd., but it is a much better class of Hotel than the ones directly across the street from Disneyland. We got a 2 queen suite, and the room was so clean and comfortable. The beds were amazingly comfortable! The bed was so much more comfortable than the one we had at the Grand Californian in December! And there were no screaming kids or maids to wake us up in the morning. This hotel was almost silent when you got into your room. The maid cleaned our room perfectly each day after we left for the parks, and we always came home to a beautifully made up room and those great beds.
reviews.title: Quiet, Comfortable and Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: The only issue we had was with the bus service (Anaheim Resort Transit). We bought a ticket each day at the front dest (4.00 per person), and would try to time our departures to the bus schedule. The bus was suppose to come every 20 minutes or so, but several times we ended up waiting 40 minutes, which is a LONG time to wait on a street corner when you want to get to Disneyland. This issue has nothing to do with the hotel, but unfortunately it really impacted our ability to get to and from the parks. This hotel would be perfect if they hired a private shuttle like the one used at the Hyatt.
reviews.title: Great option for Disney

reviews.text: But even with the shuttle issue, I would absolutely stay at this hotel again. This was probably the best hotel experience we have had in the Disneyland area, and that includes the DLR properties. It was pure comfort and ease, and felt like a vacation to us. The pool area was also very nice.
reviews.title: Disney Trip

reviews.text: My husband and two daughters (ages 10 and 5) stayed here for three nights while visiting Disneyland. We used Hilton Honors points for our stay, so we didn't pay out of pocket for our stay. We found the rooms to be spacious and very comfortable - nice linens, good assortment of pillows, living area had a comfortable sleeper sofa. It was nice having a suite as it allowed my husband and I to relax with a glass of wine after a long-day at the park without disturbing our daughters' sleep. The hotel offers complimentary breakfast buffet (perhaps only to HH members?) and we all enjoyed the quality and variety of the food. In addition, kids eat free in the restaurant for lunch and dinner, which is a nice option after spending so much at the park. We requested a top-floor room, away from the elevator and facing the park so we could see fireworks at night. They were not able to accommodate the park-facing request, but our top-floor room was very quiet. The only drawback I would list is that the shuttle service wasn't super convenient and there was some confusion when we asked for help getting a cab. Apparently, the cabs aren't allowed to drop you off at the main entrance of Disney and one cabbie even told us they weren't allowed to drop off across the street. This doesn't seem possible. The next time we grabbed a cab, we told them we were going to the Camelot Inn across the street and the driver brought us right there. We just walked across the street to the main entrance. Keep in mind, the hotel is within walking distance, but the 15-20 minute walk on top of walking around the park all day was too much for our little one. Another thing to note, the pool looks pretty lame. We were thinking we would break up our trip with a little time at the pool but there's not much to speak of.
reviews.title: Spacious room and great services

reviews.text: We chose to stay at this hotel because it was in somewhat in close proximity to Disneyland.
reviews.title: Business and Play

reviews.text: Our conference was at the the Disneyland Hotel. The hotel is a short taxi ride or a 20 minute walk to Disneyland.
reviews.title: My Anaheim Hotel of Choice

reviews.text: The staff was very accommodating and friendly. Housekeeping staff kept our room very well. They made sure our room stayed stocked with towels. I only have one complaint. Our room temperature would get uncomfortable during the day. I didn't bring this to the attention of the staff because we were in out of the room so much.
reviews.title: Better than most.

reviews.text: The food in the restaurant is very good and well priced. I also recommend walking to the Garden Walk and trying out Roy's Hawaiian Fusion.
reviews.title: Hotel is starting to feel outdated!

reviews.text: If your traveling with Teens, I recommend Downtown Disney, Gardenwalk, and the Outlets at Orange.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for a one one night stay arriving from Australia on an early morning flight. We arrived at around 8.30 am. After using a friends room to shower and change then breakfast in the restaurant downstairs we were able to check in around 10.30 am to our room. We had booked a one bedroom queen suite. The suite was a generous size with a separate sitting room. 2 super comfortable queen sized beds in the bedroom. Excellent value for the price we paid. The breakfast in the restaurant downstairs was good value for money and the servers were extremely professional and friendly. Over all we were very pleased with our room, the standard of the hotel, and the efficiency of the staff. There is a shuttle bus to Disneyland right outside the hotel. It costs $5 for the day. Worth the money.
reviews.title: A comfortable overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a really good price here with parking,but there's not a lot going on in the hotel itself.
reviews.title: Walking distance to parks.
Great Disneyland shuttle!
reviews.text: It's very formal and the bar while well stocked with your various beers/liquors is very open and has no atmosphere whatsoever if you fancy a few late night drinks. There are a couple of bars in the area however, but might be a bit hard to find as they seem to be in a shopping mall/area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a starbucks in the lobby and a 7-11 2 mins walk away on the way to the parks.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Value Near Disneyland

reviews.text: The hotel itself is very clean, we had a lovely large corner room with views. Facilities are excellent with laundry area and swiming pool, though we didn't use it and only saw it when we went to do some laundry.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very Nice,and Clean. Parking Fee not good S/b only $10 not $16
reviews.title: Disneyland

reviews.text: I stayed here with wife and kid for three nights to visit Disneyland. Being a HH Gold member, they upgraded me to a suite upon arrival. The suite is quite spacious and has all the amenities you need. My wife had minor complaint about noises from the street.
reviews.title: Very nice alternative to pricy Disney hotels

reviews.text: The hotel is very conveniently located. There are restaurants and convenience stores within a block of the hotel. There's also restaurant and cafe inside the hotel. We also got free breakfast which we enjoyed daily. We took the ART shuttle to Disneyland, which turns out to be cheaper than paying for parking at Disneyland. The Disneyland parking lot is across the street form the hotel. Walking to Disneyland only took me 15 minutes.
reviews.title: Excellent choice

reviews.text: I would definitely come back to this hotel again on my next visit. I also had stayed at Ayres (ranked 1 on TA) previously, and would pick this hotel over Ayres. Doubletree is located at a much nicer location and closer to Disneyland. If I remember correctly, the prices are comparable as well.
reviews.title: Upper floors best for quietness

reviews.text: We have just arrived home after spending 12 nights at Doubletree Suites. We had a fabulous time, and met some fabulous staff who made us very welcome.. We are a family of 2 adults and 2 children so chose to have a suite which was a real bonus. The rooms are very well maintained and clean. The location is great as it is only a short walk to Disney and there are restaurants close by. We chose to eat in the restaurant at hotel most nights and food was wonderful and service was good. It was also very reasonably priced and children ate free which was a bonus. I would definetly choose this hotel again if visiting the area as it is good quiet location and the service more than met my expectations. A very specail mention to staff members Christina, and Jerry, who were just wonderful and looked after us.The cookies were also a big hit with the children and myself. I would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of going to Disney and if you have small children just take taxi or bus to Disney.
reviews.title: Great choice for Disneyland

reviews.text: We had a very comfortable stay at the Doubletree Suites. Clean, reasonably priced and excellent value for the amount of space. We have 5 in our family and it was nice to all be able to sleep in a bed for the price of a regular hotel room. Would definitely stay again!
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: Enjoyed the hotel. Would look into staying at another Double Tree in future travels. The staff, food, and amenties were great. Long walk to Disneyland with young children. Wish they offered a shuttle. Overall Great Experience.
reviews.title: First Time at Double Tree

reviews.text: We came to Disneyland to celebrate my niece's 4th birthday so we chose the Doubletree since it was close to the Resort. This is my very first experience with Doubletree so I wasn't sure what to expect. I am someone who prefers nice hotels and excellent service and have stayed in places like Ritz Carlton, etc. Doubletree is very reasonably priced. We were pleasantly surprised and so excited to receive A+ service at this hotel! From the minute we booked to the time we walked in and throughout our entire stay we were treated like VIP guests. They seemed to truly CARE about making sure we had a nice stay. They were so friendly and when we mentioned my niece's birthday they brought her a bouquet of balloons and the smile on her face was so precious. Everyone from the top manager to the housekeeping staff to the room service staff and the guest services representative who called for our taxi service each morning was amazing. This kind of high service is usually only found in top of the line hotels or places like Nordstrom. What a gem of a hotel the Doubletree is and I would highly recommend it to all of my friends and family that want to come to Disneyland. No need to stay in a Disney Property hotel in the park with high costs... I am so glad we took a chance with the Doubletree--we will be back!! Thank you Jerry and all of your staff--we appreciate every detail you didn't know we were paying attention to :)
reviews.title: Doubletree Suites Anaheim is AWESOME!

reviews.text: Not only was this hotel close to my business meeting but also to Disneyland and a great outlet mall. The hotel had a shuttle to Disneyland that ran every 30 minutes or so and the staff were very helpful in answering my questions about the park, the outlet mall, and nearby restaurants. I wasn't there long but the stay was quite comfortable and the room was huge. There was only one small issue. My room wasn't far from the elevator and there was a mini wind tunnel between the elevator and my room door. This produced a faint whistling sound through the small crack in my door. Still, the overall stay was pleasant and I would return to this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great for Family Fun or Business

reviews.text: Our 6th stay here for our Disneyland vacation, and the only hotel we would ever consider staying at in the area. Great stay, front desk staff very helpful in directing me to the nearest Best Buy. My husband sent us with the wrong camera charger, and a Disneyland trip with no pictures to show for it was not an option. Kudos for their assistance with options/information on local businesses that might have the right camera battery charger. A 20 minute round trip to Best Buy, and crisis was averted, with plenty of time to relax by the pool before heading to Downtown Disney. Restaurant staff is excellent, we enjoy seeing familiar faces with each stay. The hostess (manager?) who seated us is phenomenal, (my apologies on not being able to recall her name.) Her warm and sincere greeting and genuine interaction with us as to how things are going were refreshing, in an era where customer service seems to be a dying art. Breakfast buffet was delightful and delicious, as usual, even for 4 picky eaters ranging in age from 6-14. Our suite was well-appointed, with very comfortable beds, pillows, and linens, very inviting after spending 10-plus hours at the parks. Oddly enough, way back in 2007--our first stay with this hotel--a Disney employee (corporate level) recommended this property to us, and we have no reason to look anywhere else. You have earned our loyalty and repeat business, and we thank you for another wonderful stay.
reviews.title: Another fabulous stay

reviews.text: this is very good hotel ,we stay for 4 nights it;s close to Disney land the room was very clean and very nice , outstanding friendly staff. Delicious breakfast
reviews.title: Vacation in USA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights, one before and one after our day at Disneyland. The rooms were clean and very nice. Access to the park was somewhat less than desireable on a $4 shuttle that picks up out on the street every 20 minutes. We ended up taking a cab. The pool area was pleasant, especially after a long day at the Park. Parking was an additional $16 per day, which is average for the area. Overall a good value.
reviews.title: The whole package

reviews.text: Our travel agent put our package together and recommended the Doubletree for 8day stay. We had a party of 5 so we got the suite with two queen in one room and the living room had a pull out bed, 2 flat screens tv. The room was perfect for us. The beds were so comfortable, the mini fridge and microwave came in handy with 3 kids. Also LOVE how the sink area is outside from the bathroom area which made getting ready much easier and quicker. After everyday of walking kids enjoyed splashing in the heated pool and hot tub outside.
reviews.title: Great Family Hotel for Disneyland. A+++++!

reviews.text: The hotel is very well maintain and extremely clean. The staff are very friendly, they do anything to make your stay enjoyable. The cookies that you receive when checking in are soooo yummy!
reviews.title: excellent price-rate option

reviews.text: The location is great. Our family had a blast in Anaheim! I would recommended this hotel to any family
reviews.title: NICE LOCATION, GOOD BREAKFASTS

aka: Doubletree Suites By Hilton Hotel Anaheim Resort - Convention
description: The newly renovated DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Hotel Anaheim Resort - Convention Center is ideally located one block from the Anaheim Convention Center and just one mile from Disneyland® Park and Disney's California Adventure® Park.
